Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic had 46 points and 10 rebounds, scoring nine points in overtime to secure the win for the Denver Nuggets.
Victor Wembanyama finished with 20 points and 23 rebounds for San Antonio but was scoreless and without a rebound in overtime.
Michael Porter Jr. added 28 points and 10 rebounds for Denver.
Harrison Barnes scored 22 points and Devin Vassell 19 for San Antonio.
Vassell tied the game at 108 with 14 seconds remaining in regulation by tipping in his own missed layup.
Zach Collins and Russell Westbrook each received a technical foul in the first quarter after taunting one another.
After stripping possession from Wembanyama, Jokic scored his 44th point on a layup to put Denver up 115-108 with 2:27 remaining in overtime.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams split the home-and-home series on consecutive nights, with the Spurs winning the previous game 113-110.
Denver's five-man bench accounted for 18 points and 21 rebounds, while San Antonio's reserves had 43 points.
Julian Champagnie was 3 for 4 on 3-pointers in the two-game set against Denver.
Others: Wembanyama is averaging 30.6 points and 11.7 rebounds in his last nine games.
The Denver Nuggets host Boston on Tuesday. San Antonio opens a four-game trip in Chicago on Monday.
